intro: Hieracium sparsum subsp. livadicanum, commonly known as the Livadican hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Europe and the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with rough textures. This subspecies is often found in disturbed or nutrient-poor environments, showcasing its adaptability to various ecological conditions.
